lead_paragraph: VANDERSALL--Thornton M.D. The Department of Psychiatry at North Shore University Hospital mourns the passing of our former Chairman, Thornton Vandersall MD on January 8, 2016. From 1974 to 1988, Dr. Vandersall's leadership was characterized by a commitment to resident education, sensitive patient care and faculty development. A board-certified pediatrician, psychiatrist and child psychiatrist, he also initiated a Child Psychiatry Division at North Shore. Dr. Vandersall received his MD degree from Jefferson Medical College in Philadelphia, his pediatric training at Bellevue and New York Hospitals, and his psychiatry and child psychiatry training at St. Luke's Medical Center. He achieved the rank of Emeritus Professor of Clinical Psychiatry at Cornell University Medical College. Engaged in both his local medical community and national psychiatry organizations, Dr. Vandersall was recognized as a life member of the Nassau County Medical Society, the Medical Society of the State of New York, and the American Medical Association; and as a Distinguished Life Fellow of the American Psychiatric Association and the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry. He influenced the careers of many psychiatrists and the lives of countless patients and families through his high clinical standards, his strong physician values, and his thoughtful gentlemanliness. John M. Kane, M.D. Chairman, Department of Psychiatry North Shore University Hospital/ Long Island Jewish Medical Center/ Hofstra Northwell School of Medicine 1/3
